commit message: changelog update

Only automatically resume those transfers that were active when the connection was dropped.

When we pause the VuzeManager, now we pass a 'disconnected' flag. If we are stopping due to disconnection, then those torrents that are not already 'STOPPED' will be marked as 'QUEUED'.
The Vuze documentation says the QUEUED state is precisely for this purpose. QUEUED is the same as STOPPED but with the only difference that it can be restarted automatically.

Only automatically resume those transfers that were active when the connection was dropped.

When we pause the VuzeManager, now we pass a 'disconnected' flag. If we are stopping due to disconnection, then those torrents that are not already 'STOPPED' will be marked as 'QUEUED'.
The Vuze documentation says the QUEUED state is precisely for this purpose. QUEUED is the same as STOPPED but with the only difference that it can be restarted automatically.
simpler. ManagerUtils.queue(dm) could fail as ManagerUtils.stop(dm) is async and the transfer might not be fully stopped by the time we want to queue it.

commenting runtime exception and just short-circuiting execution. if load torrents can only be called once, then no big deal, they should be loaded already. getting lots of crashes due to this when restarting the app while developing/testing. @aldenml let me know what you think.

don't try to pause or stop if errored.
Fixes bug where it'd let you attempt to pause a Queued bittorrent transfer.

BitTorrent Transfers won't be auto-resumed when Wi-Fi connectivity is lost and the connection is switched to 3G/4G if the user has unchecked the preference for torrent downoading with mobile data. Thanks @marcelinkaaa, @kademlia. (Boolean Algebra and code style lesson included in the commit)

Don't let the user download .torrents if they have said so on their Network Preferences.

If the user is on a mobile connection (3G/4G), a few seconds after the transfer starts, it will go to Queue state and a long toast will be shown letting the user know what's going on.
In the event the torrent transfer starts on a mobile connection and the preference is to not care about data consumption, a warning message and tip to check for Preferences is shown. This should address some complains from users that can't seem to tell when they're on Wi-Fi vs 3G/4G.

Needs a bit more testing, specially on the part where the Queue transfer is supposed to start automatically when the Wi-Fi network is available.
